column1: Mississippi producers impacted by COVID-19 should register for the webinar. https://t.co/PdCFFt7o6t

Six more counties have been  added to MS COVID-19 restrictions list - Winston Calhoun Holmes Yalobusha Montgomery and Lamar.  @tatereeves said they are monitoring Lee County where cases continue to increase.

During a @HouseAgGOP hearing today I requested @USDA Under Sec. Greg Ibach to consider providing aid to MS sweet potato farmers who have suffered because of COVID-19. They do not have a market to sell their 2019 crop. #MS01 https://t.co/zkaSSQjrkV

The hardwood industry has suffered a blow due to COVID-19. I have signed on to Congressman Fred Keller's letter to House leadership recommending additional relief. Please click for details. https://t.co/qLsQurKQwF
These men and women will always be remembered. I was grateful to have Willy Weddle represent our office honoring those who lost their lives to COVID-19. https://t.co/KdpFgIWofd

Today we are marking up the #NDAA. I am pleased the House Armed Services Committee unanimously adopted my measure to make sure troops have enough PPE as we continue to fight COVID-19. This measure bolsters and protects the readiness of our Armed Forces. https://t.co/0KsF7MsmYp

Coming to you in this week's newsletter - great stories of our 1st District residents including a new U.S. Military Academy at West Point graduate from Mississippi. Also two families helping others during COVID-19. Read more... https://t.co/XABuEac9QX https://t.co/aCuplMmoQU
COVID-19 testing continues by @UMMCnews and @msdh. Please take precautions to protect your health. https://t.co/khxUsWOpk2

Saturday June 6 is the final day the C Spire Health app will be used as a screening tool for COVID-19 testing. After that Mississippians can be screened and scheduled for appt-only testing by calling @UMMCTelehealth at (601) 496-7200 or by going to https://t.co/wDjceoNSy4.

COVID-19 drive through testing (appointment required) will be conducted on June 4 at the Becker Community Center in Amory and June 5 at the Landers Center in Southaven. You can download the C Spire app at https://t.co/yZ1eNUh8tQ or call (601) 496-7200.

The coronavirus pandemic has interfered with many traditions including high school and college graduations. Mississippians continue to be resilient. Please read my newsletter which features the leaders of tomorrow. https://t.co/VqCo7SXQEA https://t.co/aHu0pTyOoM
The Paycheck Protection Program has helped scores of Mississippi businesses stay afloat during the coronavirus pandemic. Here is the next step in the process. https://t.co/ojtjkq78sE

Farmers and ranchers who have suffered losses due to the coronavirus pandemic will soon be able to apply for assistance through the USDA. For more information please click on the link. https://t.co/GPcWhTISDQ
On Thursday @USDA hosts this webinar. Click for additional information. Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) Direct Assistance to Producers Webinar https://t.co/ZK7XaURc0m

#ToyotaMS welcomed back their team members today to a modified work environment. Changes are in place to help protect them from #Covid_19. Please read my newsletter. https://t.co/JcBvMIpGxF #MS01 https://t.co/x8EN69fhVa

Not enough can be said about the important role nurses have played in response to #Covid_19. Let us all remember their hard work and dedication on the front lines and well beyond. #MS01 https://t.co/alMh0Hz4dN
Appreciate Toyota Motor Manufacturing Mississippi and the steps they have taken to ensure a safer working environment for their team. #Covid_19 #MS01 https://t.co/15jHvonpQ9

.@NIH and @GileadSciences announces Phase Three of a clinical trial for antiviral drug remdesivir - initial data shows "clear-cut significant positive effect in diminishing time to recover" - Dr. Anthony Fauci. #COVID__19
Mississippi prepares to ease some coronavirus restrictions https://t.co/LgqXTy9Bm4
Testing for COVID-19 is taking place today at BancorpSouth Arena 375 East Main Street Tupelo. An appointment is necessary. Click for details. https://t.co/ioyFFMXCkl https://t.co/4UNHiKpkju
.@msdh announces more drive thru COVID-19 testing locations. https://t.co/S5vMODDkcI
Free @UMMCnews COVID-19 screenings will take place Tuesday April 14 at the Chickasaw County Agri-Center in Houston. For more information please click on the link. https://t.co/RRYb6AEhTl
.@USDA offers guidelines to assist rural communities impacted by COVID-19. https://t.co/PaiVvZ7nAt

.@UMMCnews and @msdh is hosting a COVID-19 testing site in Ripley today until 4 p.m. Anyone experiencing symptoms must first be screened by using the telehealth app. https://t.co/ucgrWoPP6l or call (601) 496-7200. Testing site address: 10791 B Highway 15 South.

Proud of @Taylor_Machine and @msstate for their response to #COVID19! The First District manufacturer has converted 280+ ventilators. Now shipped to @msdh for distribution. @msstate is modifying the remaining ventilators. A total of 550 to help @MSEMA and @UMMCNews. https://t.co/PkvVg8NLuy

The 2020 First Congressional District Art Competition reception will not be held due to COVID-19. Instead a winner will be announced on May 15. Artwork will be accepted until May 12. For more information please email melinda.whited@mail.house.gov https://t.co/lCSzWOYXtx

I am co-sponsoring a resolution with @RepStefanik that will hold China accountable for COVID-19. We demand an international investigation by public health officials from the U.S. and other countries to determine the amount of harm.  https://t.co/RvgrFr6F0E

America's hospital ships have been deployed to respond to #COVID19. Two years ago this month I discussed the critical role they play in times of war and peace. https://t.co/y7RzzQHT1h https://t.co/JMCB7JOosc

Please continue to be vigilant and protect your health. For the latest information on our response to the coronavirus pandemic please click on the link. https://t.co/RmEk5wV0D2 https://t.co/lls51aVMJi
.@TVAnews to offer $1B of credit support to local power companies enabling them more flexibility to respond to customers during the coronavirus outbreak. https://t.co/tbM1TRkIOB

.@TVAnews has announced plans to provide $1 billion in credit support for local power companies. This will give them more flexibility to respond to their customer's immediate needs in the wake of COVID-19.

The Mississippi Department of Employment Security website has some good information and answers to frequently asked questions for workers impacted by COVID-19. Please click on the link for details. https://t.co/kXNQP3FvTq

Our farmers and ranchers must have the support they need to feed our nation - especially in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. We cannot allow them to be left behind. It is time to pass the #CARESAct

.@UMMCnews has partnered with @CSpire to address COVID-19 with a smartphone telehealth app. Those with symptoms connect with a medical professional via the app. High risk people receive a next-day appointment for drive thru testing at MS State Fairgrounds. https://t.co/YFGzrMpsyJ
Small business owners who have been impacted by the coronavirus can apply for assistance. Click to get the process started. https://t.co/qp5gSblSIM
The U.S. Small Business Administration is offering low-interest federal disaster loans to Mississippi small businesses impacted by the coronavirus. Click to get started. https://t.co/beXbwjKlyl

I appreciated the opportunity to discuss our work in Congress to address the coronavirus on @supertalk today. To listen to the interview please click on the link. https://t.co/UUED6wf0zP https://t.co/LPWnPzPHfo
State Medical Licensure Board recommends telemedicine during coronavirus outbreak https://t.co/7Jyfej9g3L
.@realDonaldTrump has announced expansion of #Telehealth to combat the spread of #COVID19. For information please click the link. https://t.co/Cmf2rMNYbp
Please take precautions to protect your family. For more prevention information please visit https://t.co/rMIMsLoLm8.  #COVID19 https://t.co/qlrIalrzxu
Please follow these guidelines. Americans stand strong against #COVID19 https://t.co/dFt0eyiJdi
For updates on the #coronavirus including travel information please visit https://t.co/7sMv5ubrkl https://t.co/Yj8jYg9JGI
This week Congress took action to address the spread of the Coronavirus. Please read my Weekly Wrap-up. https://t.co/6c8mBRMTH1 https://t.co/cffxwPpQuo

Today the House passed with my support a supplemental funding bill to help protect American lives from the Coronavirus. The Administration's response to this public health emergency is appropriate and necessary ensuring the best possible outcome for our state and the nation. https://t.co/UmvTcReiE0
Coronavirus: Be informed and call your provider if symptoms develop https://t.co/AomrFAr6Vt
